result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Brady Richmond

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Brady Richmond in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Joseph Brady Richmond.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk appeared in court on behalf of Patrick T. Franken for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that they are now in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a plea/sentencing hearing date to Br 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Brady Richmond appeared by video.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Joseph Brady Richmond.  Attorney Jon R Josephson Jr for Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and offer; defense requested more time for review. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Brady Richmond appeared by video, in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Joseph Brady Richmond.  Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Received and Filed. nk

Defendant Joseph Brady Richmond in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State request the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Oral No Contact Order with co-defendant Trey B Champion.

Defendant Joseph Brady Richmond in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/30/22 @ 1p
